objtitle.title: *Naomi Entreating Ruth and Orpah to Return to the Land of Moab*

objinfo.printdate: 1795The characteristics of the color printing indicate that this impression is the first one printed in 1795. The second impression in this printing is *Naomi Entreating Ruth and Orpah to Return to the Land of Moab* in the Fitzwilliam Museum (Butlin 300).
objinfo.objsize: 42.8 x 58.6 cm.As is clearly the case with the untrimmed impression of "Lamech and His Two Wives" in the Tate Collection (Butlin 297), the unusual octagonal format may have been created by the printing matrix, not by subsequent trimming of the printed sheet of paper.
objinfo.medium: planographic color printing with water color and pen and ink additions to the impression

provenance.name: Victoria and Albert Museum
provenance.note: Acquired by George Blamire at an unknown date; possibly the work sold Christie's, 7-9 Nov. 1863, lot 120, with another work (£5.7s.6d. to Halsted, probably a dealer); J. E. Taylor; given by Taylor to the Victoria and Albert Museum in 1894.

desc.objtitle: Naomi Entreating Ruth and Orpah to Return to the Land of Moab, Object 1 (Butlin 299)

objnote.p: "Naomi Entreating Ruth and Orpah to Return to the Land of Moab" illustrates Ruth 1:11-17. Ruth clings to her mother-in-law on the left, while Orpah, also a widow of one of Naomi's sons, departs on the right in sorrow to return to her own land of Moab. Ruth will follow Naomi to Bethlehem. The slight halo around Naomi's head indicates her role as a forebear of Christ.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Naomi stands on the left side of the design with her arms open, receiving Ruth’s embrace. Naomi's hands are prominent, with palms out and finger's spread. A slight (but originally more prominent?) halo surrounds her head. Ruth, hunching over and looking down, embraces Naomi. Subdued radiance surrounds her head. On the right, Orpah walks away from the two women, bent over with her right hand on or behind her forehead while looking down. The scene is set before a grassy plain with mountains in the distance and probably clouds in the narrow band of sky above.

component.illusobjdesc: Naomi, an old woman, is gowned and stands with her arms extended outward from her body at 45 degrees. Her posture suggests a cruciform configuration. With open palms and spread fingers, she receives Ruth's embrace. Naomi faces forward, and her left leg steps before her right leg, making her left foot prominent. A few lines below her foot suggest that she may be wearing a sandal. A veil or scarf covers her hair and falls over her right shoulder; a faint (but originally more prominent?) halo surrounds her head. She faces the viewer though she looks somewhat to her left with her eyes lowered. Dark lines, perhaps wrinkles and veins, appear on her face.

Ruth embraces Naomi on the left. Ruth's right arm is wrapped behind Naomi, making only her right fingers discernible on Naomi’s right hip. Ruth bends forward, toward Naomi, and looks down. Ruth's left arm is extended at 45 degrees to embrace Naomi's right thigh. Ruth is gowned, with a belt at her waist and with her left foot prominent at the hem. She has long hair that cascades over her back. Her left leg is bent at her prominent knee. Golden radiance close to her head suggests a halo.

Hunched over and facing right and down, Orpah turns away from Naomi and Ruth. She walks toward the right margin with her right leg bent at the knee and extended behind her, her right foot on tiptoe. Her right arm is bent upwards towards her face, with her right hand behind (and possibly touching) her face. She has short curly hair, and her mouth may be slightly open. She is gowned, with a belt at the waist.
The foreground and middle distance of the design appears to be a grassy plain. The coloring also suggests vegetation on the distant mountains.
The foreground is a grassy plain, possibly with shadows extending from the figures toward the right. Hills and mountains rise in the distance. The narrow band of sky may include dark clouds.
